title: The Unexpected Effectiveness of One-Shot Decompilation with Claude
description: Chris Lewis's work on decompiling N64 games using Claude for one-shot decompilation, showcasing how modern AI tools can reverse-engineer complex legacy codebases. The technique demonstrates significant advances in automated code understanding and reconstruction.
author: Simon Willison

title: AI should only run as fast as we can catch up
description: Hacker News discussion about the pace of AI development and the need for human adaptation, reflecting growing concerns about AI development speed outpacing society's ability to understand and regulate it.
author: Hacker News Community

title: DeepAnalyze-8B: Agentic LLM for Autonomous Data Science
description: The first agentic LLM specifically designed for autonomous data science, capable of automatically completing complex data science tasks. This represents a significant advancement in AI coding for data science applications.
author: Ouyang et al.

title: The Biggest Physics Breakthrough Nobody Noticed
description: Two Minute Papers covers a significant physics breakthrough that received minimal attention, demonstrating their continued focus on highlighting underappreciated scientific and AI advances.
author: Two Minute Papers

title: 30x Better Physics: Why Everyone Missed This Genius Solution
description: Another recent video from Two Minute Papers covering innovative physics solutions, showing the channel's continued focus on breakthrough technologies that combine AI with physical simulations.
author: Two Minute Papers
